> Is it always the same url? Is it getting detected when you open the video directly: https://dood.re/e/yfjo6y6y50lp10fxbtm2dre788axfux

It's weird, I go to the website I mentioned and the ads are gone, but then I click on Video and it takes you to two options for the video. issue.title: Sometimes image not loading
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android, AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

Android 3.6.10 (51)

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://m.cafe.naver.com, https://cafe.naver.com, https://arca.live

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Adguard for Windows and android are all the same issues.
This problem continues with changes to mobile and PC devices.

Not all times.
Image loading failures often occur, and sometimes both PC and Android fail to load CSS, causing web pages to become unrecognizable.

At this time, everything worked fine when the Adguard filtering was turned off.

Most of them load correctly, but sometimes they don't and it doesn't seem to be a problem with the filter list.

![Screenshot_20221204-130810_Firefox_Beta](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44261958/205473958-8d1ff39e-b203-4eef-ad1d-9362455c7eb9.png)

issue.title: Sometimes image not loading
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android, AdGuard for Windows

### AdGuard version

Android 3.6.10 (51)

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://m.cafe.naver.com, https://cafe.naver.com, https://arca.live

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, List-KR

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Adguard for Windows and android are all the same issues.
This problem continues with changes to mobile and PC devices.

Not all times.
Image loading failures often occur, and sometimes both PC and Android fail to load CSS, causing web pages to become unrecognizable.

At this time, everything worked fine when the Adguard filtering was turned off.

Most of them load correctly, but sometimes they don't and it doesn't seem to be a problem with the filter list.

Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Screenshot_20221204-130810_Firefox_Beta](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/44261958/205473958-8d1ff39e-b203-4eef-ad1d-9362455c7eb9.png)

</details>

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Tq34MyenrmE](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DTq34MyenrmE) ### Comment > YouTube hides/blurs the video frame while AdGuard is enabled (the audio component continues to play properly). When AdGuard is disabled, the video works again, although there are of course advertisements. It appears that YouTube is aware that there is a blocker working, and willfully blurs out the video to force the user to disable the blocker and see the ads. Note: I am not sure which filters I have enabled, so I only selected "AdGuard base filter" for the purposes of submitting this report. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/jmOjqC9.jpg)
